intro: Draba leyboldii, commonly known as the Leybold's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of mustard and cress. This plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Draba leyboldii is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and basal rosette of narrow leaves. It is often found in high-altitude habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
